title: Congress Leaves DC as DHS Shuts Down
summary: Despite a deadlock over funding for the agency, lawmakers left town and left Democratic and White House negotiators to try to work out a deal in their absence.

title: Beyond the Big Cities, ICE Is Rattling Small-Town and Exurban America
summary: Far from the national spotlight, towns like Cornelius, Ore., and Coon Rapids, Minn., are dealing with President Trump’s expanding mass deportation effort, and the effects can be acute.

title: Trump’s Minnesota Retreat Points to the Power of Public Anger
summary: The withdrawal came as polls show Americans opposing the president’s immigration tactics, and as some Republican lawmakers began to find ways to distance themselves.

title: U.S. Inflation Eased at Start of the Year
summary: The Consumer Price Index fell in January to 2.4 percent from 2.7 percent a month

title: The Hidden Number Driving U.S. Job Growth
summary: After a year of just 181,000 new jobs, January’s 131,000 increase in the U.S. workforce was surprisingly positive. Ben Casselman, The New York Times’ chief economic correspondent, explains the numbers.

title: Bessent Pushes Senate on Fed Confirmation Amid Backlash Over Criminal Inquiry
summary: President Trump’s effort to get Kevin M. Warsh confirmed as the next Federal Reserve chair has been complicated by a criminal investigation into Jerome H. Powell.

title: The Epstein Files and the Hidden World of an Unaccountable Elite
summary: The search continues in the documents for ironclad criminal conduct, but the story of a sexual predator given a free ride by the ruling class has already emerged.

title: Conspiracy Theories Only Flourish With More Epstein Evidence
summary: The dump of millions of documents has fueled a new wave of speculation, A.I.-generated hoaxes and foreign disinformation.

title: Amid Fallout From Epstein Files, Dubai’s DP World Boss Is Replaced
summary: Sultan Ahmed bin Sulayem was credited with turning the state-backed DP World into a global logistics powerhouse. He was recently identified in correspondence with Jeffrey Epstein.

title: ’The Interview’: Gisèle Pelicot Shares Her Story
summary: In her first interview with an American media outlet, Pelicot opens up about surviving years of secret abuse — and a trial that shocked the world.

title: Venezuela’s Natural Gas, Not Oil, Might Be a Big Early Prize
summary: The South American country has natural gas that could be extracted and exported quickly, but U.S. sanctions, which are now being eased, have stymied development.

title: As Diplomats Talk, Pentagon Prepares for Possible War With Iran
summary: President Trump threatened to strike Iran, but the military has needed time to build up its forces in the region.

title: Iran Turns to Digital Surveillance Tools to Track Down Protesters
summary: As Iranian authorities restore some online services after crushing antigovernment demonstrations, they are using a technological dragnet to target attendees of the protests.

title: Looks Aren’t Everything? Clavicular Begs to Differ.
summary: Braden Peters, known as Clavicular, has emerged as a beacon for a group of narcissistic, status-obsessed young men. He wants to take his fixation with “looksmaxxing” mainstream.

title: Meta Plans to Add Facial Recognition Technology to Its Smart Glasses
summary: In an internal memo last year, Meta said the political tumult in the United States would distract critics from the feature’s release.

title: What It Means to Be a White ‘Race Traitor’
summary: From Schwerner and Goodman to Good and Pretti, white people putting themselves in harm’s way has helped galvanize Americans for justice.

title: Ukraine Says U.S. Is Increasing Pressure for a Deal as the Midterms Loom
summary: It is unclear what the Trump administration is prepared to do if it does not get the concessions it wants from Kyiv on issues like territory and elections.

title: These Ukrainian Drones Don’t Just Kill. They Deliver Oatmeal Cookies.
summary: In a war where drones are synonymous with destruction, some are also used to drop care packages to Ukraine’s frontline soldiers.

title: Man Pleads Guilty in Murder Plot U.S. Says Is Tied to Indian Government
summary: Nikhil Gupta was accused of plotting to assassinate an American citizen. Prosecutors have argued the case mirrors similar efforts against Sikhs, including the killing of one in Canada.

title: Amtrak’s Largest Train Revamp in 55 Years Is Coming Soon
summary: Step inside the sprawling factory in California where the largest fleet replacement in Amtrak’s 55-year history is coming together piece by piece.

title: How ‘The Traitors’ Builds Its Perfect Reality TV Cast
summary: The casting executives behind the Emmy-winning reality competition reveal how they create a mad mix of modern celebrity.

title: Something Surprising Happens When Bus Rides Are Free
summary: It starts at the curb. It extends far beyond that.

title: We’re All in a Throuple With A.I.
summary: What happens when the people building a new technology don’t want to use it?

title: At the Winter Olympics
summary: We look at what life is like on the ground in Milan and Cortina.

title: NJ Transit Could Be Disrupted During Portal North Bridge Construction
summary: Construction on the new Portal North Bridge is expected to disrupt commutes into Manhattan on NJ Transit, PATH and Amtrak trains beginning on Sunday.

title: San Francisco Teachers End Strike After 4 Days
summary: Public schools are expected to reopen on Wednesday for 50,000 students in the city. Teachers demanded higher wages and health care benefits.

title: Tarique Rahman Is Elected Bangladesh’s New Leader
summary: Tarique Rahman, the scion of a political dynasty, returned to sweep his party into government with a promise of change. Some have doubts.
